title: The Wyvern's Dale
opening: Under the guidance of Archsage Gotoh, Marth and the others headed to Macedon's north, to the "Wyvern's Dale". It is an undeveloped region populated with wyverns, and ruled by barbarians. But, there is no time to stop, because the fate of the world is in Marth's hands!

intro.speaker: Marth
intro.line: Jagen, where are we? Macedon? Or Dolhr?

intro.speaker: Jagen
intro.line: Both--we are precisely on the border. I hear this place is home to Macedon's great wyverns. But since the area is overrun with barbarians, even the Macedonian soldiers dare not set foot in here.

intro.speaker: Marth
intro.line: I see. You learn something new every day...

intro.speaker: Kris
intro.line: According to our scouts, a large number of wyverns and barbarians have gathered nearby. It's like Anri's Way... No, it's worse. Sire, please be careful.

intro.speaker: Marth
intro.line: Got it. Let's go, Kris. I need to know what's happened to my sister and the others... I have a dreadful feeling about this.

intro.speaker: Kris
intro.line: Who are you?! A barbarian of this dale? Please stand back, sire.

intro.speaker: Marth
intro.line: It's alright, Kris. This is Ymir, another ally from the last war. When I met him, he was holding off an entire army to protect some villagers. He's a kind and brave man.

intro.speaker: Ymir
intro.line: Yeah, the name's Ymir. I heard Marth was fightin' here and figured I'd come along too.

intro.speaker: Kris
intro.line: I-I see... How rude of me, Sir Ymir. Please forgive my insolence.

intro.speaker: Ymir
intro.line: Oh, it's okay. My face is a bit on the scary side, I gotta admit. What's your name?

intro.speaker: Kris
intro.line: Ah, yes. I am the Altean Royal Guard, Kris.

intro.speaker: Ymir
intro.line: Kris! What a name! It's a real pleasure to meet you.

visit.speaker: Young Man
visit.line: On the other side of the mountains is a small hill, called the Dragon's Table. Recently, there have been eerie roaring sounds coming from there. Grandfather and the others are afraid a demon is about to awaken. You mustn't get to close to that place.

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: This is the Wyvern's Dale. Don't go any further. Otherwise I fear you'll be burnt to death by the wyverns.

visit.speaker: Marth
visit.line: Prince Michalis!? What are you doing here? And you've suffered a grave wound. What happened?

visit.speaker: Michalis
visit.line: ...Marth... ...I have been waiting... for you...

visit.speaker: Marth
visit.line: Huh!?

visit.speaker: Michalis
visit.line: ...Take this...

visit.speaker: Marth
visit.line: ...! This is the Starlight tome. You're giving it to me!?

visit.speaker: Michalis
visit.line: That's right... Gharnef... Only with this spell can he be harmed. I managed to take it back from his possession...

visit.speaker: Marth
visit.line: Gharnef!? Where is he now?

visit.speaker: Michalis
visit.line: The Dragon's Table... Ha... I was careless... I could be... Defeated by Gharnef... Marth... Good luck... I'm already finished. If Minerva is still around... Tell her to... In my place... Rescue Maria...

visit.speaker: Marth
visit.line: Michalis!

visit.speaker: Michalis
visit.line: Your highness... I leave Maria's fate to you... Urgh.

visit.speaker: Minerva
visit.line: ............ Brother...? Could it be... Is it really you...?

visit.speaker: Michalis
visit.line: ...Minerva...?

visit.speaker: Minerva
visit.line: Ah! You're wounded! I'll go get help!

visit.speaker: Michalis
visit.line: Don't bother... This wound is beyond help. I'd rather you call for... Prince Marth. I have... something I must pass on to him.

visit.speaker: Minerva
visit.line: The prince will be here soon. Hold on, Brother! I'll tend to your wound...

visit.speaker: Michalis
visit.line: Heh... To think I'd need your help in the end... Guh... ngh...!

visit.speaker: Minerva
visit.line: Brother!

visit.speaker: Michalis
visit.line: Minerva... I have something to ask of you. Should I die... Give this tome to Prince Marth. This is as far as I can go... I leave the rest... to you...

visit.speaker: Minerva
visit.line: B--Brother... Michalis...! No... This isn't like you! When did you become so weak!? The brother I knew was strong and noble... He always found his own way, never relying on anyone else... Do you hear me? I won't accept this! You're going to pass this on yourself, without the help of your younger sister.

visit.speaker: Michalis
visit.line: Hmph... Am I being scolded now...?

visit.speaker: Minerva
visit.line: Brother, listen to me... You cannot die here. You have to live...!

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: So this is the Dragon's Altar. The place where divine dragon Naga banished the earth dragons...

end.speaker: Gotoh
end.line: Indeed. Medeus, the altar's guardian, could not tolerate the human race's atrocities against the Manaketes. Thus, he gathered the surviving dragonkin, forming the Dolhrian Empire. All to obliterate mankind. He was vanquished by Anri once and then defeated a second time by you. However earth dragons boast tremendous life force, and cannot be completely eliminated so easily... Even now, they sleep at this altar.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: You mean to say they'll awaken?!

end.speaker: Gotoh
end.line: Not exactly. Even sleeping earth dragons should not awaken for centuries or so. The next time Medeus awakens though, he will rise as a terrifying Shadow Dragon... No, wait...! Perhaps...? Yes, I see... So that's why Gharnef...

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: What's the matter, Lord Gotoh?

end.speaker: Gotoh
end.line: Prince Marth. I have finally realized the reason why Gharnef kidnapped the clerics. He intends to use them to resurrect Medeus. To hasten the awakening of a dragon requires the life force of pure, maiden women. Knowing this, Gharnef kidnapped them.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: So that means Elice and the others are in this very altar?

end.speaker: Gotoh
end.line: Indubitably... Marth, you must hurry. They are in grave danger! Medeus's awakening... is only a matter of time!!

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Sir Ymir, please forgive me for earlier.

end.speaker: Ymir
end.line: It's fine. I don't mind at all. It's rare to see someone like me anyway. But it's so warm dressin' like this. Why doesn't anybody else do this? I don't get it.

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Oh, is it warm?

end.speaker: Ymir
end.line: Yeah, it's great during winter. Hey! Why don't you try wearin' this for a change? It's a hat made from animal hide. Just wear it! You're gonna see how amazin' it is right away.

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: This is... Wow, it is a pretty great hat.

end.speaker: Ymir
end.line: See, it fits you well. Do you want to wear it for a bit?

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Yes, I'd love to.

end.speaker: Ymir
end.line: Whoa! I'm so stoked you said that! It'll look great on you! No doubt about it.

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Oh no, I don't think it suits me.

end.speaker: Ymir
end.line: That so...? Too bad. But, oh well.

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: I'm sorry. After you went to all that trouble too...

end.speaker: Ymir
end.line: It's fine, it's fine. I don't mind at all.

end.speaker: Minerva
end.line: Brother...... Brother... why...? Why here...? I--I never wanted to fight you...! I just wanted things to be like they used to... With you and Maria... Brother...... Michalis... Bro...ther......!

end.speaker: Michalis
end.line: ...Your tears... How long has it been since I saw them last...?

end.speaker: Minerva
end.line: What...? M-Michalis?! Are you...?

end.speaker: Michalis
end.line: I don't plan on dying in front of you, Minerva. I'd be an endless laughing stock. The Michalis you knew... would never die in a place like this. Am I right?

end.speaker: Minerva
end.line: Brother...! Oh, Brother!

end.speaker: Michalis
end.line: Hmph, don't get the wrong idea. You and I are still enemies... That will not change. The incompetence of your army sickens me, so you leave me with no choice but to help.

end.speaker: Minerva
end.line: Thank goodness... You've finally returned to your old self. I understand. Until the Shadow Dragon breathes his last, let us borrow your strength.
